typeProperties.value: running: checking charge plan exists and valid

activities.name: If ChargePlan not exists or not valid

dependsOn.activity: Lookup chargeplan not exists or not valid

expression.value: @equals(activity('Lookup chargeplan not exists or not valid').output.count,0)

typeProperties.value: stopped: no command given - battery NOT set for charging

dependsOn.activity: If ChargePlan not exists or not valid

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT [id]
      ,[date]
      ,[hour]
      ,[charge_trigger]
      ,[charging]
      ,[elspotprice_dkk]
      ,[elspotprice_eur]
  FROM [dbo].[chargeplan] 
  WHERE[date] = CONVERT (date, GETDATE()) AND [hour] = DATEPART(hour, GETDATE())+2
  ORDER BY [hour] ASC

activities.name: Lookup chargeplan not exists or not valid

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT [id]
      ,[date]
      ,[hour]
      ,[charge_trigger]
      ,[charging]
      ,[elspotprice_dkk]
      ,[elspotprice_eur]
  FROM [dbo].[chargeplan] 
  WHERE[date] = CONVERT (date, GETDATE()) AND [charge_trigger] = 1
  ORDER BY [hour] ASC

scriptLines: body as (data as (attributes as (battery_charged_energy as short[], battery_discharged_energy as short[], consumed_energy as short[], direct_usage_energy as short[], end as string, grid_feedin_energy as short[], grid_purchase_energy as short[], measurement_method as string, produced_energy as short[], resolution as string, start as string), id as integer, type as string)),

body as (help as string, result as (fields as (id as string, type as string)[], records as (HourDK as string, HourUTC as string, PriceArea as string, SpotPriceDKK as double, SpotPriceEUR as double, {_full_text} as string, {_id} as integer)[], sql as string), success as boolean),

query: 'SELECT TOP 50 [id]
      ,[date]
      ,[hour]
      ,[est_consumption]
      ,[est_production]
      ,[surplus_production]
      ,[charge_potential]
      ,[charge_trigger]
      ,[charging]
      ,[accumulated_charge]
      ,[elspotprice_dkk]
      ,[surplus_sellable_production]
      ,[sale_potential_dkk] 
      ,[elspotprice_eur]
      ,[sale_potential_eur]          
  FROM [dbo].[chargeplan] 
  WHERE[date] = CONVERT (date, GETDATE())
  ORDER BY [hour] ASC',

source1 aggregate(objArr = collect(@(id, date, hour, est_consumption, est_production, surplus_production, charge_potential, charge_trigger, charging, accumulated_charge, elspotprice_dkk, surplus_sellable_production, sale_potential_dkk, elspotprice_eur, sale_potential_eur) )) ~> aggregate1
